example.translation: This is about one day, my mother, my elder sister and I went to dig our field to plant lentils, there at the Tangoca field.
We also took some spades with us and went to the field.

example.detailedTranslation: that field house=abl comeinf much far cop.pstpst[3sg]
example.translation: The field was quite far from our house.

example.translation: When we arrived at the field and began to dig the weed, the sun burnt down on us mercilessly.

example.translation: But there was no shady place.
There was no water, too.

example.translation: There was a small stream, a bit farther from the field.
Mother told me like this:
On the way, I came to a place a little further away from the field.

example.translation: While I was eating under the tree, without me noticing, something black, smelling awfully like chicken droppings, dropped on my hand.

example.translation: When I looked up into the tree what had fallen down, there is an owl!
That owl made me really angry.

example.translation: I tried to climb the tree to catch it.

example.translation: But the tree was huge.

example.translation: When I had climbed up into the tree and looked, I saw a large hole.

example.translation: Then, I wanted to see what was in the hole, even more than I wanted to catch the owl.
In that nest there were two eggs, too.
Then it began to peck me on my head.

example.translation: I was really afraid, and when I tried to get down from the tree, the branch on which I stood cracked.
I was about to fall down.

example.original: heko=na whak=pe atek hetu=hoŋ ka haŋcaŋcaŋ chuyaŋ.
example.translation: My clothes got caught on another branch, and then I was dangling there.
Even then, the owl would not stop pecking me.

example.translation: It pecked me on my head, painfully; and I was bleeding, too, and it hurt so much.

example.translation: I also tried to scare off the owl, but then I do not know anything more, because I was frozen in shock.

example.translation: My mother and my sister came looking where I had gone.

example.translation: Looking for me at the riverside, they saw me hanging there.

example.translation: So they came quickly and got me down.

example.translation: That time, the owl, too, flew away to its nest, screeching.

example.translation: Later, when I woke up and looked around, I had been sleeping on a rock.
Then, my mother and my sister grabbed me.
When we told you to bring water, what did you hear?
Somehow you did not die, but almost!
Of course my mother and my sister loved me.

example.original: hakhok=ŋa=go lemsaŋ khaʔla luya: picchanacha leŋma=hoŋ pyak chocholaplap menjokma=ha.

example.translation: Later, convincing me, they said the following: ‘Children should not be naughty.’

example.translation: Really, that day, because I did not listen to my mother and sister, I had almost gone to heaven.

example.original: ama=nuŋ ana=ŋa yyogan=niŋ=bi ka hensen ŋwayaŋan=bi.
example.translation: If my mother and sister had not looked for me, I would not be here now.

example.translation: But I was happy, because from that day on, I never did mischievous things again.

example.original: ka haʔniŋ tumha=ci=ga ceʔya=ca yemma taroktuŋ.
example.translation: I began to be obedient to my elders.

example.translation: Even now, when I hear the sound of an owl, I get a strange feeling.
It feels like it is still pecking me on the head.
